description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign an executive action formally asking officials to take steps to dismantle the Department of Education, his latest effort to reduce the size of the federal government and its workforce.
title: Trump Set to Sign Executive Order to Dismantle Education Department

description: Taiwan’s top envoy to Washington said the island democracy isn’t freeloading off the US for its defense against China and that it’s taking collaborative steps to bolster its security.
title: Taiwan Envoy Rejects ‘Freeloader’ Tag as US Urges Defense Boost

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, antitrust reporter Leah Nylen looks at the impact of the political realignment at the Federal Trade Commission. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Sets Up Another Test of Presidential Power With FTC Firings

description: Argentina’s lower house of Congress upheld President Javier Milei’s emergency executive decree backing a new deal with the International Monetary Fund, a key legislative step that clears the way for a formal announcement on the details of a future program.
title: Congress Upholds Milei’s Decree to Back New IMF Argentina Deal

description: Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu had emerged as Turkey’s strongest political challenger to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. But that threat may have dissipated after Imamoglu was detained by Turkish authorities on March 19 on charges of alleged corruption and aiding a terrorist organization.
title: How Istanbul’s Mayor Emerged as Erdogan’s Top Rival

description: South Africa, facing the prospect of ArcelorMittal SA closing two steel mills crucial to the local manufacturing industry, has begun a review of import tariffs on the metals and is proposing other methods of protecting the industry.
title: South Africa, Facing Mill Closures, Begins Steel Tariff Review

description: The University of California will soon impose a system-wide hiring freeze to rein in costs as the university braces for potential funding cuts, said President Michael Drake.
title: University of California to Order Hiring Pause as It Braces for Funding Cuts

description: US President Donald Trump told Iran’s Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei in a recently delivered letter that his nation has a two-month deadline to reach a new nuclear accord, according to a person familiar with its content.
title: Trump Letter Gave Iran Two-Month Deadline for Nuclear Deal

description: Christopher Stanley, the cybersecurity engineer who has worked for two of Elon Musk’s companies and the billionaire’s effort to reshape the federal government, resigned from the Fannie Mae board of directors a day after he was appointed to the post, according to a regulatory filing.
title: Musk Ally Stanley Abruptly Resigns From Fannie Mae Board

description: The crypto industry is on a roll in Washington and it’s not just because of Donald Trump.
title: Crypto’s Clout in Washington Is Soaring

description: Stellantis NV Chairman John Elkann says Europe’s auto manufacturers don’t need the defense industry to survive, after some governments called on carmakers to contribute to a defense push.
title: Stellantis Says Auto Industry Doesn’t Need Defense to Survive

description: Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency recruited an assistant to billionaire Ken Griffin to help cut costs across the US national security establishment.
title: Musk’s DOGE Hires Ken Griffin Staffer for National Security Work

description: The UK government is considering paring back the powers of its planned football regulator as part of a wider clamp-down on bureaucracy.
title: Keir Starmer Considers Cutting UK Football Regulator’s Powers

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is expected to announce that she’s rebuilt all of the £9.9 billion ($12.8 billion) fiscal buffer that was wiped out in the weeks following her October budget.
title: Reeves’ Cuts Put UK Government on Track to Recover Lost Headroom

description: Iceland’s central bank Governor Asgeir Jonsson signaled that the island nation’s companies are likely to direct exports toward Europe as a response to a weakening of the US dollar amid worries over President Donald Trump’s trade war.
title: Iceland Trade May Shift in Favor of Europe, Central Banker Says

description: South Africa’s financial regulator is working on a plan to ensure billions of rand in unclaimed retirement, severance and death benefits are distributed.
title: South Africa Weighs Plan for $4.8 Billion in Unclaimed Benefits

description: The Trump administration is appealing a judge’s order requiring Elon Musk and his Department of Government Efficiency to comply with evidence demands from Democratic state officials who claim the billionaire is exercising unconstitutional power across the US government.
title: Trump Administration Fights Order to Turn Over DOGE Records

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy agreed to halt strikes on Russian energy assets, according to a person familiar with the situation, an initial step in US President Donald Trump’s effort to end the three-year war.
title: Zelenskiy Backs Trump Proposal to Halt Strikes on Energy Assets

description: Israel’s military began a limited ground operation into Gaza, it announced on Wednesday, as the country steps up pressure on Hamas to release hostages.
title: Israeli Forces Begin Limited Ground Operation in Gaza

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio delegated oversight of what’s left of USAID to a staffer with Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency, in another step toward dismantling the aid agency despite several court challenges.
title: Rubio Delegates DOGE Staffer to Oversee What’s Left of USAID

description: House Democrats are pressing President Donald Trump’s Department of Government Efficiency for more transparency on what it’s doing to police conflicts of interest in billionaire Elon Musk’s effort to reduce the size and scope of government.
title: House Democrats Ask DOGE to Produce Staffer List, Ethics Policy

description: The Trump administration has frozen $175 million in federal funding to the University of Pennsylvania, citing policies allowing transgender athletes to compete in women’s sports, according to a post on X from the White House’s Rapid Response account.
title: Trump Freezes $175 Million to Penn Over Transgender Athletes

description: The Strait of Hormuz, a narrow waterway at the mouth of the Persian Gulf, is rarely far from the center of global tensions. A major shipping route that handles around 26% of the world’s oil trade, it’s closely watched for signs of disruption.
title: Why Strait of Hormuz Is Vital, and Risky, for Shipping

description: After a string of legal losses for his administration, President Donald Trump’s call to impeach a federal judge — and an ensuing rebuke by the US Supreme Court chief justice — is laying the groundwork for a deepening clash between the White House and the judiciary.
title: Trump Call for Impeaching Judges Fuels Showdown With Courts

description: A top adviser to US President Donald Trump denied Russia broke an agreement not to attack Ukrainian energy infrastructure, and hailed the pact as a breakthrough that could end Moscow’s global isolation and revive energy projects such as the Nord Stream 2 pipeline.
title: Witkoff Says Russian Drones Hit Before Putin Ordered Directive

description: Since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine more than three years ago, vital energy facilities have been targeted countless times by missiles and drones in both countries.
title: How Russia-Ukraine Energy Ceasefire Could Affect War

description: Russian courts last year confiscated 500 billion rubles ($6 billion) of property illegally acquired by officials, according to the country’s top prosecutor.
title: Russia Replenishes Budget Seizing Property in Anti-Graft Drive

description: The International Criminal Court’s survival is under threat following US President Donald Trump’s sanctions, according to the top judge at the tribunal that doles out justice to perpetrators of some of the world’s gravest crimes.
title: War Crimes Court Says Trump Sanctions Put Its Existence at Risk

description: The UK government rejected a demand by Russian President Vladimir Putin for Ukraine’s allies to suspend weapons supplies to Kyiv during any truce.
title: UK Rejects Putin’s Demand to Suspend Military Aid to Ukraine

description: Canada added new residents at the slowest pace in three years due to falling immigration, winding down a post-pandemic population boom that strained the economy and soured public sentiment toward newcomers.
title: Canada Population Growth Slows on Temporary Resident Crackdown

description: The Bank of France reported a widening loss in 2024 after booking one-off gains the previous year and as it continues to digest rapid changes in the European Central Bank’s monetary policy in recent years.
title: Bank of France Losses Widen Because of Costs From ECB Policies

description: Israel says the resumption of deadly strikes in Gaza is aimed at increasing pressure on Hamas, though it’s also bolstered Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s grip on power and caused significant unease among swathes of the public.
title: Netanyahu Shores Up Power Over Divided Israel With Return to War

description: Serbian lawmakers approved the resignation of Prime Minister Milos Vucevic, starting a countdown for either a new government to be formed or a snap election held amid massive anti-graft rallies.
title: Serbia Confirms Premier’s Resignation Amid Months of Protests

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico struck a deal with rebellious lawmakers to restore his parliamentary majority, potentially breaking an impasse that’s crippled his legislative agenda.
title: Slovakia’s Fico Set to End Parliament Deadlock With New Majority

description: Billionaire Hong Kong tycoon Li Ka-shing has found himself in the middle of the China-US geopolitical tussle after announcing a deal to sell his Panama Canal port assets.
title: How Billionaire Li Ka-Shing’s Panama Deal Raised the Ire of China

description: Ben & Jerry’s accused parent company Unilever Plc of firing its chief executive officer, claiming he was ousted because of disputes over the ice cream brand’s social mission.
title: Ben & Jerry’s Says CEO Fired by Unilever on Political Stance

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will hold a phone call with Donald Trump on Wednesday to discuss the details of US president’s conversation with Vladimir Putin, he told reporters in Helsinki.
title: Zelenskiy Says Will Talk to Trump on Wednesday

description: The military-led West African nations of Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger have announced their withdrawal from the Organisation Internationale de la Francophonie, which brings together French-speaking countries.
title: Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso Quit Organization to Promote French

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump-Putin Call Shows Little US Pressure for Russia Concessions

description: The president is promising significant renovations to remake federal buildings in his own image, even as his administration is pushing to cut costs through mass firings.
title: Despite Cost-Cutting Moves, Trump Plans to Remake DC in His Style

description: Kyiv expects to be briefed on Wednesday by the US about the outcome of the phone call between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin, a Ukraine official said.
title: Ukraine Expects US Briefing on Trump-Putin Call on Wednesday

description: Generation Z faces stagnant living standards, sky-high housing costs and a flatlining economy in Britain today, and yet they’re less gloomy about their life prospects than the rest of the population.
title: Britain’s Poorest Generation Is More Cheerful Than Its Richest

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government renewed the appointment of Bank of Israel Deputy Governor Andrew Abir, a decision that came after weeks of delay that raised concerns over the ruling coalition’s respect for the institution’s independence.
title: Bank of Israel Deputy Governor Approved For New Term After Delay

description: A plan by the Trump administration to introduce fees on the use of Chinese commercial ships is likely to damage the US economy and may fail to reverse China’s shipbuilding dominance, a top shipping trade group said.
title: Shipping Trade Group Says Trump Port-Fee Plan Will Hurt US

description: Vladimir Putin used his phone call with Donald Trump on Tuesday to say that the US could get played by Russia — literally.
title: Putin Puts Ukraine Truce on Ice in Search for Trump Partnership

description: Canada’s Liberal Party has jumped into a lead in some public opinion polls on the eve of an election, as voters respond to Justin Trudeau’s exit and Mark Carney’s rise to lead the government.
title: Carney’s Liberals Surge in Polls With Canada’s Election About to Start

description: The chief executives of more than a dozen oil companies will deliver a message of gratitude — as well as caution — when they meet with President Donald Trump on Wednesday.
title: Oil Titans Uneasy Over Tariffs and Crude Prices Meet With Trump

description: Romanian Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu said his government may be hobbled if the presidential candidate jointly backed by the ruling coalition fails to win an election in May, adding to the Black Sea nation’s political turmoil.
title: Romania Presidential Vote Risks Political Shake-Up, Premier Says

description: A Ukrainian drone strike started a fire at a Russian oil depot connected to the Caspian Pipeline Consortium pumping station damaged in an earlier attack last month.
title: Drone Strike Sets Fire to Russia Oil Depot Near Damaged CPC Link

description: Taiwan identified 2027 as the potential year for a Chinese invasion for the first time in its annual military drills, as concerns grow on the self-ruled island about tensions with Beijing.
title: Taiwan Defense Drills Identify 2027 for Potential China Invasion

description: Rising taxes, slowing deals, and political volatility are weighing on the French capital’s ambitions to become Europe’s preeminent financial center.
title: Peak Paris? Global Banks Put Their French Hiring Plans on Ice

description: Istanbul’s mayor, Ekrem Imamoglu, was detained at his home Wednesday morning, a day after Turkish authorities revoked his university diploma in a move that could bar him from challenging Recep Tayyip Erdogan in the next presidential election.
title: Turkey Detains President Erdogan’s Main Political Rival Imamoglu

description: The Trump administration is prepared to give Venture Global LNG Inc. conditional approval to export natural gas from a planned facility in Louisiana that had stalled under former President Joe Biden.
title: Trump to Approve LNG Exports From Venture Global’s CP2 Project

description: President Donald Trump expressed caution over closer ties between China and Russia, outlining plans to improve ties with two countries that have united in opposing the US on the world stage.
title: Trump Says US Doesn’t Want Russia, China Moving Closer Together

description: Colombian Finance Minister Diego Guevara confirmed earlier news reports that he was submitting his resignation after only three months in office, a move that had sent the country’s assets tumbling on Tuesday.
title: Colombia’s Finance Chief Resigns, Confirming Investor Fears

description: Indonesian lawmakers are moving swiftly to pass a controversial bill that will expand the role of the military, even as public criticism mounts that the changes are reminiscent of the Southeast Asian nation’s authoritarian past.
title: Indonesia Fast-Tracks Military Changes Despite Public Backlash

description: The Trump administration’s purge of US government workers has gutted a Department of Homeland Security unit created to combat online radicalization and credited with helping disrupt more than 1,000 violent plots in the past few years, according to current and former officials.
title: DHS Slashes Personnel Leading Fight Against Domestic Extremism

description: US President Donald Trump said he would rather work with the Liberal Party leader in Canada to resolve a trade war he instigated with Ottawa, weighing in on an expected national election in the neighboring North American country.
title: Trump Says It’ll Be Easier to Deal With Liberal Leader in Canada

description: President Vladimir Putin refused to give Donald Trump the 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine he and his team had demanded on the path toward ending the three-year conflict. It was still good enough for the US president.
title: Putin Spurns Ukraine Ceasefire in Talks But Trump Calls It a Win

description: President Donald Trump’s administration on Tuesday released previously classified documents related to the assassination of former President John F. Kennedy, fulfilling a campaign promise to make the material public.
title: Trump Releases Once Classified Files on JFK Assassination

description: Most UK regions are set to fall further behind London over the next three years, according to a new analysis, highlighting the Labour government’s challenge to improve living standards across the country.
title: Inequality to Widen as UK’s ‘Levelling-Up’ Plan Lies in Tatters

description: The Irish Central Bank has revised down its outlook for the economy, citing an unprecedented rise in geopolitical uncertainty that could have an outsized impact on Ireland.
title: Irish Central Bank Revises Down Economic Forecast on Trade Risks
